ConceptDef.label: Trade goods and trade beacons
ConceptDef.helpText: To send items or silver to orbital traders, you must build an ORBITAL TRADE BEACON and place a stockpile of items near it.

ConceptDef.label: Arresting worsens faction relations
ConceptDef.helpText:
Warning: The person you are trying to arrest may not go quietly.

If you arrest a non-colonist or a colonist from another faction, their entire faction may become your enemy. 

This arrest has a {0} chance of succeeding, based on the social skill of the arrester.

ConceptDef.label: Flick designations only designate
ConceptDef.helpText: Note: This only designates that a colonist should flick the switch.\n\nNothing will actually happen until a colonist comes and flicks the switch by hand.

ConceptDef.label: Maximum number of player colonies
ConceptDef.helpText:
Warning: RimWorld is designed to be played with one player colony at a time. Multiple player colonies are allowed as an experimental testing feature only.

Playing with multiple colonies will cause gameplay imbalances and split your focus, as well as likely causing performance slowdowns.

We recommend that you play with the one-colony maximum the game was designed for, at least for your first few games.

ConceptDef.label: Trading permit requirements
ConceptDef.helpText: Trading here requires the title of {0}.\n\nEnsure any trade caravan you send has someone with the title of {0} or higher.

ConceptDef.label: Steam Deck controls
ConceptDef.helpText: Use the trackpad to move the cursor and the right trigger button to click. Press {Key:Accept} to accept and {Key:Cancel} to go back.

ConceptDef.label: Steam Deck controls
ConceptDef.helpText: Press X to open the architect menu and {Key:TogglePause} to pause and resume the game. Use triggers for primary and secondary clicks. Zoom in and out and scroll through lists with {Key:MapZoom_In} and {Key:MapZoom_Out}. Press and hold the L5 back button to pan the camera with the touch screen and simulate secondary clicks.
